Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Brevinin-1Ma (1S=S, XXU; UCSS1a; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals)
Sequence Information.Source: Rana sierrae, California, USA, North America

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of the peptide shows 87.5% similarity tofrog Brevinin-1AUa. GRAVY: 1.23; Mol Wt: 2527.215; Mol formula: C118H205N27O28S2.Activity: Active against fungal pathogens B.  dendrobatidis Bd (MIC 12.5 uM) and B. salamandrivorans (MIC 12.5 uM).SAR: A substitution of leucines to isoleucines (seq: FLPIIAGIAANIVPKIICSITKKC) led to a loss of antifungal activity against Bd (MIC >200 uM). It promotes probiotic organisms. Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Woodhams DC, Rollins-Smith LA, Reinert LK, Lam BA, Harris RN, Briggs CJ, Vredenburg VT, Patel BT, Caprioli RM, Chaurand P, Hunziker P, Bigler L.2019
Literature Information.Title: Probiotics Modulate a Novel Amphibian Skin Defense Peptide That Is Antifungal and Facilitates Growth of Antifungal Bacteria
